In this PR, it is shown that the single functors `C â¥¤ HomologicalComplex C c` preserves limits and colimits.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9657436675/job/26636704583)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9657436675/job/26636704083)
Looks good to me now!
Looks good to me now!

```suggestion
lemma isZero_single_comp_eval (j i : Î¹) (hi : i â‰  j) : IsZero (single V c j â‹™ eval V c i) :=
  Functor.isZero _ (fun _ â†¦ isZero_single_obj_X c _ _ _ hi)
```
This could be golfed like this, unless you think that's not so readable.

```suggestion
  preservesLimit {K} := âŸ¨fun hc => by
    rw [Functor.isZero_iff] at hG
    refine IsLimit.ofIsZero _ ?_ (hG _)
    apply (K â‹™ G).isZero (fun X â†¦ hG _)âŸ©
```
You can also do this if you want (and similarly on the next).

```suggestion
variable (J : Type*) [Category J] [HasZeroObject D] [HasZeroMorphisms D]
```
Should J maybe be explicit here? Or will this never be ambiguous?
Can you upgrade them to `PreservesLimitsOfSize`?
Thanks for the suggestion.
Do we have the inverse `IsZero -> IsLimit`? Are they useful?
I have just added the converse assertions `IsLimit.isZero_pt`, etc.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Homology) the single complex functor preserves (co)limits
